item.title: Embattled Burundi President Sets New Dates for Elections
item.description: President Pierre Nkurunziza said legislative elections would be held June 29, and the presidential vote July 15, despite continuing protests over his plan to seek another term.
item.dc:creator: SADI NIYUNGEKO and ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH

item.title: Militants Hit Karnak Temple, in 2nd Recent Attack on Egyptian Tourist Sites
item.description: The explosion in Luxor came about a week after gunmen shot and killed two tourism police officers near the pyramids of Giza, raising fears that militants want to hurt the tourism sector.
item.dc:creator: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: Pope Creates Tribunal for Bishop Negligence in Child Sexual Abuse Cases
item.description: Roman Catholic bishops accused of covering up or failing to prevent the sexual abuse of children by priests will be subject to judgment and discipline by the tribunal.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and LAURIE GOODSTEIN
item.media:description: Bishops greeted Pope Francis at the end of his Wednesday general audience in Saint Peter's Square at Vatican City.

item.title: Pakistan, Brushing Aside Pleas for Mercy, Executes Man Convicted at 15
item.description: Aftab Bahadur was imprisoned on charges of killing a woman and her two children during a robbery attempt, but human rights groups say he was tortured into confessing.
item.dc:creator: SALMAN MASOOD
item.media:description: Relatives reacted to the execution of Aftab Bahadur, 37, in Lahore, Pakistan, on Wednesday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: European Businesses Hit by China’s Cooling Economy
item.description: Nearly 40 percent of European companies in China that were surveyed were planning to cut costs, and 61 percent of those said they would do so through layoffs.
item.category: European Union Chamber of Commerce in China
item.dc:creator: DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: Jörg Wuttke, president of the European Chamber of Commerce in China, presenting the chamber's Business Confidence Survey in Beijing on Wednesday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: With Decision Near on Hong Kong Elections, Beijing Affirms Its Case
item.description: Hong Kong legislators are expected to vote soon on a proposal to allow all eligible residents to vote for the city’s leader, but only from a candidate list vetted by Beijing loyalists.
item.dc:creator: ALAN WONG
item.media:description: A pro-democracy legislator, Ronny Tong, sitting with placards marked with yellow crosses placed as lawmakers walked out of the Legislative Council chamber on April 22 in a protest against the Beijing-backed election plan.

item.title: With U.S. as a Model, China Envisions Network of National Parks
item.description: Chinese officials and an American research center have announced a plan to undertake trial national park projects in nine provinces over the next three years.
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG
item.media:credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times
item.media:description: Tourists at the mineral pools of Huanglong Park in Sichuan Province, China.

item.title: U.S. Shifts Stance on Drug Pricing in Pacific Trade Pact Talks, Document Reveals
item.description: A newly leaked Trans-Pacific Trade Partnership annex dated December 2014 reveals the Obama administration is no longer demanding protection for pharmaceutical prices.
item.category: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN WEISMAN

item.title: Rocket Attack in Afghanistan Kills Civilian With U.S. Defense Dept.
item.description: The employee, identified as Krissie K. Davis, 54, of Talladega, Ala., worked for the Pentagon agency managing the withdrawal of wartime equipment.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: MUJIB MASHAL

item.title: Remains of 44 Victims of Germanwings Crash Are Flown Home to Germany
item.description: Families prepared to receive the bodies of loved ones killed in the French Alps including 16 high school students from the town of Haltern am See.
item.dc:creator: MELISSA EDDY

item.title: Malaysia Detains 4 Westerners Accused of Taking Nude Photos on Mountain
item.description: Some local officials have been quoted as suspecting a connection between the trekkers’ behavior and an earthquake weeks later that killed 18 people.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Mount Kinabalu, Malaysia’s highest peak, on Saturday, a day after an earthquake left 18 people dead.

item.title: U.S. Embracing a New Approach on Battling ISIS in Iraq
item.description: The Obama administration is planning to send hundreds of additional military trainers to help Iraqi forces retake Ramadi and repel the Islamic State.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: China’s Troubling Robot Revolution
item.description: Will automation gut the country’s labor force, just as it needs consumer spending to bolster economic growth?
item.dc:creator: MARTIN FORD

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: The German Government’s Surveillance Hypocrisy
item.description: The Germans have secretly helped the N.S.A., even as they condemned U.S. spying in Europe.
item.dc:creator: ANNA SAUERBREY

item.title: 메르스 바이러스 확산 경로: 한 명이 여러 병원과 연관돼
item.description: 한국은 중동호흡증후군(MERS)이 급속히 확산하기에 이상적인 곳일 수 있습니다. 한국의 병원 응급실에는 병상과 의자가 다닥다닥 붙어있고, 환자들은 여러 병원들을 골라 다닙니다.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: A teacher took a student's temperature in Seoul on Monday.

item.title: Survey Points to Challenges NATO Faces Over Russia
item.description: A substantial number of Europeans do not believe that their own countries should rush to defend an ally against attack, according to a comprehensive survey to be made public on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: A Russia-backed rebel in eastern Ukraine on Tuesday. Russia has used "hybrid war" tactics to mask its operations there.

item.title: U.S. Embracing a New Approach on Battling ISIS in Iraq
item.description: The effort to retake Ramadi and push back the Islamic State effectively delays plans to recapture the city of Mosul this year.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Gen. Martin E. Dempsey in Tel Aviv on Tuesday. He met with Defense Minister Moshi Yaalon and other Israeli officials.

item.title: South Korean Leader Postpones U.S. Trip Amid MERS Outbreak
item.description: President Park Geun-hye was scheduled to meet with President Obama next week, but an aide cited “the anxiety among the people over the situation” at home.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: Pedestrians wore protective masks in Seoul on Tuesday. Nearly 2,900 people in the country have been isolated as a precaution.

item.title: Questionable Expenses by Lawmakers in Other Countries
item.description: From private moat cleanings to a sadomasochistic performance, the reimbursement claims of lawmakers from other countries make the Canadian Senate’s look tame.
item.dc:creator: KARIN ROBERTS

item.title: World Briefing: Egypt: State Dept. Says It Won’t Meet With Brotherhood Group in Washington
item.description: United States officials will not meet with visiting members of a delegation from Egypt’s Muslim Brotherhood, a State Department spokesman said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS
